intro: Acourtia wislizeni var. wislizeni, commonly known as the desert milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit and pale green to yellowish foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Acourtia wislizeni var. wislizeni plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and provides forage for wildlife.
